page.title: 02Shops, Avon Drive, Bedford
page.content: The parade of shops on Avon Drive is one of two parades which serve the area. It has a supermarket, a green- grocer's, a butcher's, a newsagent's (with sub-post office) and a health food shop. Nearby is the Tiger Moth public house and a garage with servicing. When interviewed, the present owner of the supermarket, Mr.Patel, stated that 'it is a good area to have a business'. Mr.Cunnington (newsagent) said that they served about one thousand customers each day and that the biggest sales are of cigarettes and cigars. His sub-post office is very busy. His main worry is to stop shop-lifting. Likewise, Mr.Saint (butcher), Mr. Benson (greengrocer) and Mr.Linganagam (health foods) were pleased to be doing business in the area.
